Verses.20:
Then He looked up towards His disciples, and began to speak.
	"Blessed are the poor, for yours is the Kingdom of God.
Verses.21:
Blessed are you who hunger now, for you will be satisfied.
	Blessed are you who weep now, for you will laugh.
Verses.22: Blessed are you when people hate you, exclude you, insult you, and scorn your name as evil, because of the Son of Man.
Verses.23: Rejoice on that day and leap for joy. Behold, your reward is great in heaven. For their ancestors used to treat the prophets the same way.
Verses.24: But woe to you who are rich, for you are receiving your comfort in full.
Verses.25:
Woe to you who are well-fed, for you will be hungry.
	Woe to you who laugh, for you will mourn and weep.
Verses.26: Woe to you when all people speak well of you, for their ancestors used to treat the false prophets the same way."

Changes: 2023-07-20 - Paul Prins: First translation of chapter 6:20-26.
